page.title: 05Under Whitle, near Longnor
page.content:
I live at Under Whitle, one and a half miles from Longnor. It used to have 119 acres when Captain Finney used to rent it out but now it has only 52. We had our mains water and electricity put in about two and a half years ago.
Just across our field there is a cellar which used to belong to a house called Slacks Bank.
A quarter of a mile to the south-east is a half-fallen down cottage called Meah Dowl. It used to be rented out by Captain Finney. It has no mains supplies and no drive.
Captain Finney lived at Broad Meadow which was built in the early 17th century. He was an alcoholic and had to sell his land to buy more drink.
